title: BSS-001-MIY-002: The Priest of Sethet-Ka
content:
The blue house with a white roof belonging to @[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811) is found easily enough. It fits the same style as the surrounding buildings with nothing standing out to attract attention. Read the following:

[section: dialogue-box] The plain house stands among many homes along the road. Well-kept bushes and trees tastefully decorate the quiet property. A stone pathway leads to two white double doors that appear to be the main entrance. All the white-washed shutters on the windows are closed [/section]

A [b]DC 14 Intelligence (Investigation) check[/b] reveals that front double doors are barred from the inside and cannot be opened. Upon inspection, the shutters are sealed shut and bar access through the windows. 

Traps on both doors can be detected with a [b]DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) check[/b] and disarmed with a [b]DC 10 Dexterity check[/b] using [b]thieves' tools[/b]. If the disarm attemp fails, a needle pierces the character's hand and they take [b]1[/b] piercing damage plus [b]3 (1d6)[/b] damage. 

The doors can be opened with a [b]DC 12 Dexterity check[/b] using the [b]thieves tools[/b] or a [b]DC 15 Strength check[/b] to force it open. The keys from @[Khatim](person:b1050a84-4af0-4ea2-b781-084d555331a7) unlock the doors without setting off the traps.

[h2] The Abandoned Temple [/h2]

[b][h3] Kitchen (Area 1) [/h3][/b]

Both entrances lead into areas (1) and (3), which are areas that @[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811) maintains to keep up normal appearances when there are unexpected visitors.

The room on the left (1) appears to be a kitchen.

[b][h3] Seating Room (Area 2) [/h3][/b]

The large room in the middle of the entrances is a seasting room (2) with a sitting area on the south side of the room. The furniture, while clean, looks like it has never been used.

[b][h3] Servant's Room (Area 3) [/h3][/b]

The right entrance leads into a room that appears to be a servant's room (3). Looking around the servant's room at various books and journals will identify the room as belonging to @[Khatim](person:b1050a84-4af0-4ea2-b781-084d555331a7). A [b]DC 16 Intelligence (History) check[/b] plus proficiency in Abyssal (or a successful check at [b]DC 20[/b] without) indicates that many of the texts detail rituals to show devotion to a demon.

[b][h3] Pool Room (Area 4) [/h3][/b]

Each of the previous rooms enter down into a pool area (4) where it appears that @[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811) bathes, there are three more steps down that are blocked off by expensive cloth. Read the following:

[section: dialogue-box] You enter a large rectangular pool room. A large sigil is painted on the floor, surrounded by manacles mounted to the walls. A wide eye centered in the middle of a pentagram stands out in white paint with deep grooves gouged into the floor. Evenly spaced unlit candles complete the circle's sinister implications. [/section]

If the party makes noise at any point upon entering the temple, four [b]skeletons[/b] come through the central staircase, and attack them. @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) can join the fight to aid in combat. A [b]passive Perception DC 10[/b] alerts them to the skeletons' presence; otherwise, they begin the round [b]suprised[/b]. After the encounter, the party can explore any of the staircases, the right, left, or center.

[b][h3] Storage Area (Area 5) [/h3][/b]

The staircase on the left leads into a hallway with a long pool of water that is clearly a storage area (5). It is filled with dried herbs and vials. A [b]DC 12 Intelligence (Arcana) check[/b] OR [b]DC 12 Wisdom (Medicine) check[/b] finds a [i]Poisoner's Kit[/i] that hints that the ingredients are used in poisons and spellcasting. A [b]DC 12 Intelligence (Investigation) check[/b] reveals [i]two daggers[/i].

The connecting door leads into the priest's workroom (11)

[b][h3] Library (Area 6) [/h3][/b]

The staircase on the right leads into a library with a long pool of water (6). It almost seems out of place compared to the other areas; it has fine rugs, a luscious reading chair, and a table with brandy and glassware. A large chandelier makes the room deceptively cozy. A [b]DC 10 intelligence (Investigation) check[/b] of the dry bar reveals [i]two fine cigars (valued at 1 GP each)[/i].

The northern door leads into a closet room area (12).

[b][h3] Chamber of Offerings (Area 7) [/h3][/b]

The small chamber is adorned with faded murals depicting ancient rituals and figures presenting gifts to @[Sekhemtara, Flame of the Holy Sands](person:26ed13fb-1e5b-4f51-9c09-ff1143a30bef), the ancient @[Dragon](species:d109839a-329c-4ebd-8911-b65e7b6234de) God-King. Its faded paint is red. A low stone altar, covered in dust, sits at the centre of the room. Offerings of old - dried reeds, broken clay pots, and tarnished trinkets - lie scattered around it.

[section: lore-box] [img:6457745]
[center][i]Ancient Y'Mataran mural that depicts Sekhemtara, the ancient @[Dragon](species:d109839a-329c-4ebd-8911-b65e7b6234de) God-King[/i][/center]
[/section]

A [b]DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) check[/b] reveals a small, hidden compartment in the altar containing [b]2 GP[/b] and a [b] simple brass amulet depecting a scarab beetle (worth 5 GP)[/b]. If players investigate the offerings, they find a [b]vial of holy water[/b] hiden among the broken pots.

[b][h3] Trapped Burial Room (Area 8) [/h3][/b]

A room with images of sleeping warriors carved on the walls. The air is musty, and the stone floor is covered in ancient hieroglyphs, warning of curses for those who distrubed the rest of the dead. The lid of the sarcophagus has been shifted slightly, as if someone - or something - left them in haste.

A [b]DC 10 Wisdom (Perception) check[/b] reveals pressure plates near the sarcophagus. Stepping on one triggers a dart trap that shoots from a hidden slit in the wall, dealing [b]1d4 piercing damage[/b].

A [b]DC 12 Dexterity check[/b] using [b]thieves' tools[/b] can disarm the pressure plates.  Inside the sarcophagus, if the players are willing to take the risk, they find a [b]rusty bronze dagger with an inlaid symbol of protection[/b] (functions as a normal dagger but is of sentimental value to Talona's worshippers).

[b][h3] Room of the Scorpion Idol (Area 9) [/h3][/b]

This room contains a stone pedestal at its center, upon which rests a scorpion-shaped idol carved from black onyx. The walls are decorated with intricate carvings of desert creatures - snakes, scorpions, and vultures. Faint magical energy pulses from the idol, causing the air to shimmer slightly.

If the idol is touched without proper reverence (a prayer or a small offering), a [b]swarm of tiny scorpions[/b] emerge from the cracks in the floor. A [b]DC 10 Intelligence (Religion) check[/b] reveals that saying a prayer to desert spirits or placing a small offering (e.g., food or a coin) before taking the idol will pacify the swarm.

The scorpion idol itself is worth 25 GP but radiates faint magic that could intrigue a local scholar or collector.

[b][h3] Antechamber of Echoes (Area 10) [/h3][/b]

This room features a circular basin in the center, filled with clear, unmoving water. Carvings of jackal-headed figures and coiled serpents surround the basin, and the floor is covered in sand. The walls amplify any sound made, causing even whispers to echo.

A [b]DC 10 Intelligence (Arcana) check[/b] reveals that the basin's water is enchanted. If a player drops a coin or a small item into the basin and speaks a question while standing back, the water will swirl, and a voice will answer with a single-word hint or clue relevant to the dungeon.

Each player can use the basin once before the magic fades. Searching the sand around the basin with a [b]DC 12 Wisdom (Perception) check[/b] uncovers a carved lapis lazuli bead worth [b]10 GP[/b].

[b][h3] Priest's Workroom (Area 11) [/h3][/b]

Alchemy benches along with a 6 1/2-foot table line this neatly organised room. A [b]DC 14 Intelligence (Investigation) check[/b] of the longer table shows dried blood and other liquids that have soaked into the wood over time.

The eastern door leads into the ritual room area (13) which is currently locked. The door can be opened with a [b]DC 12 Dexterity check[/b] using the [b]thieves' tools[/b] OR a [b]DC 15 Strength check[/b] to force it open.

[b][h3] Closet Room (Area 12) [/h3][/b]

Several hooded black robes hang  on pegs next to a pair of worn, blood-stained boots. A basin, filled with fresh water, sits atop a small table. A long bench is pushed up against the wall. The western door leads into the ritual area (13) which is currently locked. The door can be opened with a [b]DC 12 Dexterity check[/b] using the [b]thieves' tools[/b] or a [b]DC 15 Strength check[/b] to force it open.

[b][h3] Ritual Room (Area 13) [/h3][/b]

The room to the north of the temple is locked by all three doors. The doors can be opened with a [b]DC 12 Dexterity check[/b] using the [b]thieves' tools[/b] or a [b]DC 15 Strength check[/b] to force it open. Once the party opens the door, read the following:

[section:dialogue-box] A nobleman in loose black robes sits on a velvet dining chair. He raises his glass of wine to @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) as you enter the room. [i]"Honestly, I thought you'd be here days ago. We've been so bored waiting for your arrival."[/i] He jerks his head behind him and you see a beautiful ravenhaired woman chained to the wall. She yanks against the bonds and glares at the priest. [i]"My apologies, where are my manners? My name is @[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811), and you have all broken into my private workshop."[/i] He stands to give a mocking bow, picks up his quarterstaff from next to the chair, and continues. [i]"Now that you're here, sweet @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc), you can join the sacrifice to my patron. Money is simple to procure. Power is not. Your legs came at the cost of @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e)' voice, but the reward I will get for all of you will make my revenge even sweeter. I'll make sure to kill her first so you can watch."[/i][/section]

The party can question @[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811) about his motivation, but he attacks after one or two questions. 

[b][h3] Conclusion[/h3][/b]

If Hasina is defeated, @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) releases @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e) from her bindings. Read the following:

[section: dialogue-box] @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) supports @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e) as the @[Bard](profession:d9074e5a-f72e-49d0-8480-5e60938812a0) tries to stand and straighten out stiff muscles. [i]"Um, hello,"[/i] @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) says to her, sounding a bit insecure. [i]"I'm @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc). I'm sorry I got you into this mess, but I'm not sorry to have met you. I will cherish the memory of hearing you sing aboard that caravel, and I am at your service."[/i] @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e) smiles and wraps an arm around @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) in a loose embrace. @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) looks at you and grins for the first time since you've met her. [i]"Thank you, all of you. Let me get @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e) someplace safe and I'll meet you shortly at @[The Gilded Oasis](landmark:81967146-e033-47a0-bc9a-2142d6c96b5a)."[/i][/section]

@[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) and @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e) do not immediately leave if the party wishes to talk to them further or check @[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811) for valuables. @[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811) has [b]180 GP[/b] and a [b]@[Pot of Awakening](item:e0a8ca61-058e-4700-a6ba-7c1d0d7057b7)[/b] near him. A [b]DC 16 Intelligence (Investigation) check[/b] finds a [b]Enspelled Staff (w/ Light cantrip)[/b] and a [b]Potion of Healing[/b].

[b][h3] Happily Ever After[/h3][/b]

At this point, @[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) and @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e) can leave. They pay [b]10 GP[/b] per party member later at @[The Gilded Oasis](landmark:81967146-e033-47a0-bc9a-2142d6c96b5a). However if the party chooses to restore @[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e)' voice, reward each palyer with an additional 100 XP. There is no single way to accomplish this; reward creativity at the table.

sidebarcontent:
[section:lore-box] [center][h2]Dramatis Personae[/h2][/center]

[ul][li]@[Nefara](person:f798a59d-89f9-46df-9fde-e4ada154e4fc) (neh-FAH-rah): A former river djinni turned human, now desperate to save Isiris[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]@[Isiris](person:ad02fa53-b54f-41cd-8fe2-644c948cba6e) (ee-SIH-ris): A talented bard that was kidnapped by Hasina Sebekem[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]@[Hasina Sebekem](person:9579d73d-8889-4904-b2ab-7122772ab811) (seh-BEH-kehm): A vengeful priest seeking power through dark rituals[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]@[Khatim](person:b1050a84-4af0-4ea2-b781-084d555331a7) (KAH-teem): An elf servant loyal to Hasina Sebekem[/li][/ul]
[ul][li]@[Rashidi](person:52f6cf0f-39d3-47cd-91c5-0a20ce392170) (rah-SHEE-dee): A tavernkeeper and retired adventurer, Owner of The Gilded Oasis[/li][/ul]
[/section]
